Summary: Shortly after 1 am let dog out and saw a stationary "blob" in sky. Got binoculars, much smaller, could see horizontal oval shape with minimum five lights, pulsating, I believe center light was red. Lights sent spiking beams. Don't know what it was!
trends: There have been no other sightings in Monmouth
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsThe dog woke me at about 1 am needing to go out. I put her out and saw a large, "blob" of light in the sky, much, much bigger than stars or satellites. I went to another part of the house and got binoculars. When I returned the light was much smaller, closer to the size of a star. I trained the binoculars on it and saw an object with a horizontal, oval shape that had I believe five lights, adjacant in a horizontal line,the center one I believe was red. All of the lights were pulsating and sent spikes of light up and down. I woke my husband but when he got to the window, the object was gone. As he went back to the bedroom, I again spotted a moving light and trained my binoculars on it. It was the same object I had just observed. I saw it very briefly again and then it disappeared. I really don't know what I was looking at. The object appeared to move left to right, from the large "blob" to the smaller sized light. Then it moved away in a northerly direction. I remain perplexed by the incident. I keep replaying it in my head, but have not yet figured out what it might have been.
